definition: in full swing (idiom)/(in a) frenzy/buzzing with activity
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: Open Salon, engage in lectures, essay contest, be in full swing for a while.
sentences.chinese: 開沙龍，搞講座，徵文比賽，熱火朝天過一陣子。

sentences.english: During the Spring Festival, activities of supporting the government and cherishing the people were in full swing.
sentences.chinese: 春節期間擁政愛民的活動搞得熱火朝天。

sentences.english: Thus, in the movie world the work is humming already.
sentences.chinese: 而在電影行業，工作已經進行得熱火朝天了。

definition: both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to drip with sweat/sweat poured off (him)
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
rushed and muddled
to keep silent
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
cheering excitedly (idiom)/jubilant
bulldozer
dejected/disheartened/listless
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
reluctant to part
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
